pullRequest.body:
This PR removes `@[simp]` from all the lemma with a lambda as the #discr_tree_simp_key. These @[simp] annotations were not used anywhere in Mathlib, and are potentially expensive as they will fire anytime the simp target is a lambda. 

See [zulip](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/287929-mathlib4/topic/bad.20simp.20discrimination.20tree.20keys/near/497258784), and thanks for @JovanGerb and @kbuzzard for diagnosing.

### PR summary [541742aafa](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/21395/commits/541742aafa125d22ca4f9f06d11929c35d93cf21)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](https://speed.lean-lang.org/mathlib4/run-detail/7e8f69ed-15a0-4595-b80b-4d67cb73e917) for commit 77c6358f699bb9f303e4ee5e2f3c37824dc20d61.
There were [no significant changes](https://speed.lean-lang.org/mathlib4/compare/fc291e3e-3b96-4464-9369-07d8d3657a57/to/7e8f69ed-15a0-4595-b80b-4d67cb73e917) against commit 96a5ba5ce504f8b8e6acd659015e46e641d7af10.

|File|Instructions|%|
|-|-:|:-:|
|`build`|-13.67‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(+0.00%)|
|`lint`|-91.174‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(-1.19%)|
|`Mathlib.Algebra.Homology.HomotopyCategory.Triangulated`|+1.330‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(+1.07%)|
[CI run](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13128902076)
I think the lemmas should rather be fixed to not contain lambdas. I'll try my hand at the `Combinatorics.Line` ones
Done in #21405. You can drop them from this PR.

I've now also fixed the ones in Analysis.Fourier.AddCircle, Analysis.Fourier.AddCircleMulti and Analysis.InnerProductSpace.l2Space in #21405. The only one that's left is Data.Fin.VecNotation, which contains a lambda by design.
What's the deal with the one in `VecNotation`? It's not used anywhere.

It came all the way from https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib3/pull/2656, the original PR about vector notation by @Vierkantor. I assume they wanted to ensure simp confluence, but genuinely no clue how.
I recall I had to add it at some point for confluence, but if the test file works now then presumably `simp` has gotten smart enough to not need it. So please go ahead and remove `empty_val'` :)

I think the problem here  and for the other fourier stuff is actually this lambda-introducing instance:
```lean
instance instCoeFun : CoeFun (HilbertBasis Œπ ùïú E) fun _ => Œπ ‚Üí E where
  coe b i := b.repr.symm (lp.single 2 i (1 : ùïú))
```
which should be using `FunLike` instead.
Or perhaps the coercion isn't injective, in which case probably this should be a new `HilbertBasis.coe` def.
Eric, as mentioned above, this is being fixed in #21405
I think #21440 (or rather, a follow-up that uses FunLike) is a better fix for `HilbertBasis` specifically.

pullRequest.title: chore: remove @[simp] when the discr_key is a lambda
